publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4591 Rob Gibson: Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School Success—That the Parliament congratulates the Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School on winning the Novice/Juvenile competition of the North of Scotland Branch of the Royal Scottish Pipe Band Association event at the Aberdeen Highland Games on Sunday 18 June 2006; notes that this victory was gained after competing against other Novice/Juvenile Bands and Adult Grade 4 Bands and that this is the first time that a Juvenile/Novice Band from outwith Aberdeenshire has won at the event in 10 years, and recognises this achievement as outstanding since the band have been performing for one year.

S2M-4591 Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School Success (lodged on 20 June 2006) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Jim Mather*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*, Robin Harper*, Tommy Sheridan*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Richard Lochhead*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-4591 Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School Success (lodged on 20 June 2006) Dave Petrie*

S2M-4591 Rob Gibson: Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School Success—That the Parliament congratulates the Ross and Cromarty Pipes and Drums School on winning the Novice/Juvenile competition of the North of Scotland Branch of the Royal Scottish Pipe Band Association event at the Aberdeen Highland Games on Sunday 18 June 2006; notes that this victory was gained after competing against other Novice/Juvenile Bands and Adult Grade 4 Bands and that this is the first time that a Juvenile/Novice Band from outwith Aberdeenshire has won at the event in 10 years, and recognises this achievement as outstanding since the band have been performing for one year. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Jim Mather, Ms Maureen Watt, Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Christine Grahame, Dave Petrie
